Isaiah or Isaias__25.1: O Lord, thou art my God, I will exalt thee, and give glory to thy name: for thou hast done wonderful things, thy designs of old faithful, amen.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.2: For thou hast reduced the city to a heap, the strong city to ruin, the house of strangers, to be no city, and to be no more built up for ever.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.3: Therefore shall a strong people praise thee, the city of mighty nations shall fear thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.4: Because thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the needy in his distress: a refuge from the whirlwind, a shadow from the heat. For the blast of the mighty is like a whirlwind beating against a wall.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.5: Thou shalt bring down the tumult of strangers, as heat in thirst: and as with heat under a burning cloud, thou shalt make the branch of the mighty to wither away.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.6: And the Lord of hosts shall make unto all people in this mountain, a feast of fat things, a feast of wine, of fat things full of marrow, of wine purified from the lees.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.7: And he shall destroy in this mountain the face of the bond with which all people were tied, and the web that he began over all nations.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.8: He shall cast death down headlong for ever: and the Lord God shall wipe away tears from every face, and the reproach of his people he shall take away from off the whole earth: for the Lord hath spoken it.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.9: And they shall say in that day: Lo, this is our God, we have waited for him, and he will save us: this is the Lord, we have patiently waited for him, we shall rejoice and be joyfull in his salvation.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.10: For the hand of the Lord shall rest in this mountain: and <u>Moab</u> shall be trodden down under him, as straw is broken in pieces with the wain.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.11: And he shall stretch forth his hands under him, as he that swimmeth stretcheth forth his hands to swim: and he shall bring down his glory with the dashing of his hands.
Isaiah or Isaias__25.12: And the bulwarks of thy high walls shall fall, and be brought low, and shall be pulled down to the ground, even to the dust.
